description:
Make your talking head videos look awesome in minutes. Get amazing results from any DSLR or camera. Even your iPhone, smart phone or webcam. Without spending a fortune!

[Last updated January 2016]

I'll show you step-by-step how to purchase, set up and use your own DIY lighting rig (for a maximum of $47).

Or you can use sunlight to improve your videos for free!

This IS NOT an extensive course on video recording, DSLR camera set up and professional lighting.

This course is designed to bring you the best possible results in the shortest period of time.

In just over an hour I want to transform you in to a DIY lighting guru and make your videos look professional. Without wasting any money or time.

Although a knowledge of camera equipment is useful, it is not essential. Good lighting can make any camera look great, even in 'auto' mode.

Plus, you don't need a DSLR or pro camera. The lighting rig that I will show you step-by-step how to build and use will make your phone camera or webcam look awesome too.

Improving your technique for lighting is the easiest way to increase the quality of your videos and therefore increase sales, views, downloads - whatever it is you're after.


In the course you will learn:

  • How to make your videos look awesome in minutes
  • The easiest way get incredible results from any camera (even an iPhone, smartphone or webcam)
  • How to get and build your own DIY lighting kit for under $47
  • The best way to use sunlight to improve your videos for free
  • How to chose the perfect backdrop for your talking head video
  • The rules for framing your video that you should never break

Who this course IS NOT for:

- People looking for a long extensive course about cameras and videography that will teach you everything that you need to know

- People that already have a professional lighting set up.

- People that don't shoot videos themselves and pay a professional company to film for them.

- People that are on the fence about enrolling. I want all of my students to be 100% dedicated to learning. If that's not you, don't enroll. No hard feelings!


Who this course IS for:

- People looking to make their videos look amazing with the least amount of time and money spent.

- People that are always looking to improve the quality of their content.

- People who film their own videos and don't have a lighting set up.

- People that know nothing about lighting.

- Online course creators, mediapreneurs, YouTube video creators, promotional video creators, interview video creators... anyone who creates videos on a budget!


Your Videos Need to Look Professional

Sure, you could get by with a basic video. It may look amateur and average, but it's the content that matters right?

Not true.

The content does matter, don't get me wrong. It's still the most important thing to please your viewers and keep them engaged.

But how many people will stop watching before you get a chance to win them over?

How many people have decided to not buy your online course because it looks cheap? Because it looks like it might be a scam?

Many people now argue that design is king, not content.

You need great design to grab the viewers attention. You need great design to gain the viewers trust and keep them there.

And this doesn't only apply to web design, or graphic design - it 100% applies to video design as well.

On Udemy, you can definitely get away with average looking videos. Most of the courses on here look pretty crap (sorry).

But imagine how many more customers you would get if your promo video looked professionally filmed?

How much easier would it be to grab peoples attention and stop them clicking on to a competitors course with an awesome looking promo video (this is a huge problem on Udemy - your competitors courses are right below the 'purchase' button).

If you sell online courses outside of Udemy, or create promotional videos for your business, you'll understand the importance of having a professional quality video.

It's not just beneficial to have professional looking videos, it's essential. If your videos look amateur, people will lose trust in your brand immediately.

"Okay, we get it, professional looking video is important!", I hear you shout :)

Do you know what makes all the difference between an amateur looking video and a pro looking video?

Lighting.

That's what I want to teach you.

Lighting can make an affordable camera look amazing. Without good lighting, an expensive professional camera would still look amateur.

I want to show you (step-by-step) the fastest, easiest and cheapest way to put together and use your very own lighting rig.

I'll show you exactly what equipment to buy (all on Amazon) to create your $47 lighting rig.

Don't waste any more time. Enroll now, and short cut your way to professional talking head videos.

See you inside :)
title: DIY Talking Head - Lighting and Video Production on a Budget
